intro: Pedicularis pacifica, commonly known as the Pacific lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and meadows. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are clustered in racemes. It has a unique appearance with its hairy stems and showy, spurred petals.
